homepage.description: Click on any Smart City to visualize its details. Search option is also available. Click on the help button for any doubts or confusion. Click on Visualizer to download and visualize any csv file or any kml data

about_page.description: Smart City Dashboard is a Flutter app to visualize many available public data of various smart cities through various visually appealing dashboards and charts. This project was created as a part of Google Summer of Code 23 under Liquid Galaxy. Developed thanks to the TIC Laboratories of the Scientific Part of Lleida, Liquid Galaxy EU, Liquid Galaxy LAB, Google Developer Groups Lleida, Women Techmakers Lleida and Parc Agrobiotech Lleida. The app can show realtime weather along with hourly data, various analytic data of the cities and other important data like environment, population etc. The app supports an integrated Google Map to control the Liquid Galaxy. It automatically travels to the location of the city selected and also facilitates the tour of the city's major locations. It can also visualize various KML data in the bigger screen of Liquid Galaxy for better analysis. One of the major feature of the app is that even though the size of the app is small, it can show data of many GBs as it downloads it in realtime and also features to clean those data so that the device does not get clogged of unnecessary large data. The app supports 2 themes and many languages as well. The navigation of the app is also one tap to any page or feature, so the user can explore the app with ease and simplicity

dashboard.downloadable_content_unavailable: Content Unavailable. Please go to the settings and download all the available content.
dashboard.available_kml: Available KML data to download and visualize

settings.connection_required: Connection to Liquid Galaxy is required to use this feature!
settings.kml_success: KML file is now running successfully!
settings.mic_on: Microphone on. Speak out any city name or data tab name!

help_page.nav1: This is the homepage of the app. Click on any city to visualize its data.
help_page.nav2: Click on the app icon to go back to the homepage.
help_page.app_bar: The app bar shows the status of the app's connection to the internet (Online / Offline) and to Liquid Galaxy (Connected / Disconnected) respectively.
help_page.search: You can search for any city name or the cities which contains the particular data (For example, Environment as shown in the picture). You can type it or say by pressing the microphone icon. The bar will become green when the microphone is on.
help_page.settings: You can connect to Liquid Galaxy by going to the settings page. Then fill out the required details in the places provided and click on the CONNECT TO LG button. Then the buttons to control Liquid Galaxy will also appear like this.
help_page.settings_theme: The themes and language of the app can be changed from here.
help_page.feature1: The right panel of the city data page will change dynamically based on which data selected. In the Weather tab, you can select between 3 days to show the weather data of.
help_page.feature2: In other tabs, you can select to download the KML files and visualize in the Liquid Galaxy. The size of the KML files are shown to avoid any unnecessary data loss. Also, to use this feature, you need to connect to Liquid Galaxy first.
help_page.feature3: In the About Tab, you can take a tour to some of the important locations of the city.
help_page.feature4: You can change the type of the Google Map by choosing one of the three options available.
help_page.content: If you see this in any tab, then simply go to the settings page to download the required data.
help_page.tab: The left tab bar will change automatically depending on the page of the app. When in the homepage, it will show the general instruction and the help page button. And when in any city page, it will show the tabs of data available for the city. The settings and about page is independent of other pages and can be selected from any page without changing the left tab.

visualizer.note: NOTE: Column numbers starts from 0. For Y-Axis plotting, column must contain numerical values

new_york.description: New York, often called New York City or NYC, is the most populous city in the United States. With a 2020 population of 8,804,190 distributed over 300.46 square miles (778.2 km2), New York City is the most densely populated major city in the United States. The city is more than twice as populous as Los Angeles, the nation's second-largest city, and has a larger population than 38 of the nation's 50 states. New York City is located at the southern tip of New York state. The city constitutes the geographical and demographic center of both the Northeast megalopolis and the New York metropolitan area, the largest metropolitan area in the U.S. by both population and urban area. With over 20.1 million people in its metropolitan statistical area and 23.5 million in its combined statistical area as of 2020, New York City is one of the world's most populous megacities in the world.

charlotte.description: Charlotte is the most populous city in the U.S. state of North Carolina. Located in the Piedmont region, it is the county seat of Mecklenburg County. The population was 874,579 at the 2020 census, making Charlotte the 15th-most populous city in the U.S., the seventh-most populous city in the South, and the second-most populous city in the Southeast behind Jacksonville, Florida. The city is the cultural, economic, and transportation center of the Charlotte metropolitan area, whose 2020 population of 2,660,329 ranked 22nd in the U.S. Metrolina is part of a sixteen-county market region or combined statistical area with a 2020 census-estimated population of 2,846,550.

austin.description: Austin is the capital city of the U.S. state of Texas, as well as the seat and most populous city of Travis County, with portions extending into Hays and Williamson counties. Incorporated on December 27, 1839, it is the 10th-most-populous city in the United States, the fourth-most-populous city in Texas, and the second-most-populous state capital city. It has been one of the fastest growing large cities in the United States since 2010. Downtown Austin and Downtown San Antonio are approximately 80 miles (129 km) apart, and both fall along the Interstate 35 corridor. Austin is the southernmost state capital in the contiguous United States and is considered a Beta-level global city as categorized by the Globalization and World Cities Research Network.

health.lake_health: Creeks and Lakes in good health

seattle.description: Seattle is a seaport city on the West Coast of the United States. It is the seat of King County, Washington. With a 2022 population of 749,256 it is the most populous city in both the state of Washington and the Pacific Northwest region of North America. The Seattle metropolitan area's population is 4.02 million, making it the 15th-largest in the United States. Its growth rate of 21.1% between 2010 and 2020 made it one of country's fastest-growing large cities. Seattle is situated on an isthmus between Puget Sound (an inlet of the Pacific Ocean) and Lake Washington. It is the northernmost major city in the United States, located about 100 miles (160 km) south of the Canadian border. A major gateway for trade with East Asia, Seattle is the fourth-largest port in North America in terms of container handling as of 2021.

boulder.description:
Boulder is a home rule city and the county seat of Boulder County, Colorado, United States. It is the largest city in Boulder County, with a population of 108,250 at the 2020 United States census, making it the 12th most populous city in Colorado. Boulder is the principal city of the Boulder, CO Metropolitan Statistical Area and an important part of the Front Range Urban Corridor.

Boulder is located at the base of the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, at an elevation of 5,430 feet (1,655 m) above sea level. The city is 25 miles (40 km) northwest of the Colorado state capital of Denver. Boulder is a college town, being home to the flagship campus of the University of Colorado, the state's largest university.
